Message:
...I took care of the
first round of assassins,
but more were sure
to come soon.

I needed to gather
some weapons quickly...

But, my vision began to blur...
Maybe I’d lost too much blood.

Seeing me covered in wounds,
the girl burst into tears.

She kept saying
it was all her fault—
my injuries,
the little bird’s death...

Her incoherent words
continued to pour out,

but my hazy mind could barely
grasp anything at all.

“If you were just going
to abandon me,
why did you make that promise?!
You only gave me false hope!”

And yet, the moment
I heard those words...

it was almost as if I was
looking at my younger self.

Clinging to my parents’ promise,
waiting endlessly,

only to be hurt every time
I realized they wouldn’t come.

Though it caused me
so much pain,
I continued living
because of that very promise.

Without it,
I would have long since—
...My wounds felt strangely hot.

I recognized this sensation.
This was...pain.
Footsteps approached.

Damn it,
how was I supposed to
make it out in this state...?!

“It may not have been very long,
but I’ll always treasure the time
we had spent together.
Thank you so much...”

As she uttered those words,
the girl just smiled softly...
